page.title: 13STANDEN
page.content: Standen is a Victorian country house and associated farmland now owned by the National Trust. It was built from 1892-94 by the architect Phillip Webb for a London solicitor named James Beale. Webb was a friend & colleague of William Morris and the house, which is little altered from the original design and is the only work of Webb's to survive in this state, contains much William Morris wallpaper & fabric & furniture made by Morris' company. The house had electric light from the start, the light fittings were designed by W A S benson. There is contempory china in the house by William de MOrgan. The house is now open to the public three afternoonsa week in the summer. The National Trust have made a shop & a tae roomin some of the outbuildings, they maintain the garden and woodland.
